title: Bipartisan Board OKs NSA Surveillance Program, With Suggestions
teaser: The independent Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board has offered recommendations on how to reform one of the surveillance programs deployed by the National Security Agency. The privacy board found that the program, which was revealed by former NSA contractor Edward Snowden, is constitutional and free of abuse, but it's still proposing reforms.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
